biography.summary: Peter Welch is the United States Senator from Vermont, serving since January 3, 2023. He previously served as a U.S. Representative for Vermont from 2007 to 2023. His work has focused on healthcare, veterans' affairs, the economy, and climate policy.
biography.career: Longtime public servant who served in the U.S. House before being elected to the Senate.

contact.office_address: 115 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports expanding access and affordability; supports strengthening the Affordable Care Act.
Supports aggressive action to reduce emissions and invest in clean energy.
Supports progressive taxation and closing loopholes; favors responsible fiscal policy.
Advocates for universal background checks and enhanced gun safety measures.

bills_sponsored.title: Health Care Affordability and Accessibility Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to expand access to affordable health care and reduce out-of-pocket costs.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives representing Vermont (at-large district).
Elected as U.S. Senator from Vermont; began term in the Senate.

videos.title: Peter Welch on the Senate Floor
